description_txt: stated on April 18, 2013 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: Says "we allow more people into America legally than all other countries on the planet combined."

description_txt: stated on May 16, 2013 in an interview with Texas Monthly magazine.:
quote_txt: "We have one charter school that for seven years has been rated unacceptable."

description_txt: stated on April 30, 2013 in a speech:
quote_txt: The state of Georgia lost 16 percent of its employees last year, and that percentage has risen over the past three years.

description_txt: stated on May 6, 2013 in an Austin American-Statesman news story:
quote_txt: Says only 25 percent of Texas high school students graduate prepared for college or careers.

description_txt: stated on May 15, 2013 in a House floor speech:
quote_txt: Says, "In Oregon in 2010, 49 percent of all pregnancies were unintended."

name_txt: Marylanders to Prevent Gun Violence Education Fund
description_txt: stated on May 19, 2013 in a television ad:
quote_txt: A law that mandates fingerprinting for gun purchasers is "a requirement that's reduced gun crimes in the five states where it's the law."

description_txt: stated on April 30, 2013 in a Facebook page post:
quote_txt: "New Jersey's governor cut $1.6 billion from public education while handing out $2.1 billion in corporate tax breaks, more than the entire previous decade."

description_txt: stated on May 16, 2013 in The Providence Journal:
quote_txt: "If you are black or brown, you are nine times more likely to be stopped and frisked" in New York City.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • May 23, 2013

description_txt: stated on May 19, 2013 in a comment on 'Meet the Press':
quote_txt: "We have a tax code that allows groups to use their political operations within the tax code, under the guise of a charity, to use undisclosed millions of dollars to do political campaigns."

description_txt: stated on April 12, 2013 in a statement during a state House Finance and Appropriations Committee hearing:
quote_txt: "Forty-six cents of every dollar" Ohio could get for Medicaid expansion "is going to come from China or some other country that doesn’t like us very much."

description_txt: stated on May 17, 2013 in an interview with Fox News:
quote_txt: "The IRS doesn't have to prove something against you ... you've got the burden of proof."

description_txt: stated on May 20, 2013 in a press release:
quote_txt: "This budget also reflects the smallest state government workforce per 1,000 residents in Florida in this century."

description_txt: stated on May 19, 2013 in an appearance on CNN’s ‘State of the Union’:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton "was asked repeatedly to provide security in Benghazi on several occasions, including direct cables."

description_txt: stated on May 6, 2013 in video remarks to the Family Research Council:
quote_txt: Says Sam Houston opposed slavery and as governor said Texas should not leave the union over slavery.

description_txt: stated on May 15, 2013 in a news release:
quote_txt: A referendum "gives the people the chance to decide" on cutting the Milwaukee County Board budget by two-thirds

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2013 in a twitter post:
quote_txt: There are about 120,000 solar energy jobs in the United States, but only 1,700 of them are in Georgia.

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2013 in remarks on the floor of the Texas Senate.:
quote_txt: Says it's "estimated that 300 babies a year are sent home from the hospital with an unrecognized congenital heart defect; it is the most common birth defect in America."

description_txt: stated on May 17, 2013 in an opinion column.:
quote_txt: Says Texas high school graduates must pass Algebra II to be eligible for automatic admission to state's public universities.

description_txt: stated on May 15, 2013 in an interview on Fox News' "On the Record" with Greta Van Susteren:
quote_txt: The IRS is going to be "in charge" of "a huge national database" on health care that will include Americans’ "personal, intimate, most close-to-the-vest-secrets."

description_txt: stated on May 20, 2013 in 2013-14 veto message:
quote_txt: "We are already almost halfway to our 2010 goal of creating 700,000 new jobs in seven years."

description_txt: stated on May 15, 2013 in an interview on Fox News' "On the Record" with Greta Van Susteren:
quote_txt: The IRS is "going to be in charge of our health care."

description_txt: stated on May 15, 2013 in an interview on Fox News' "On the Record" with Greta Van Susteren:
quote_txt: "The IRS will have the ability potentially" to deny or delay health care.

description_txt: stated on May 3, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says Fulton County government hasn’t raised its millage rate since 1991.

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: A state report’s "projection is that approximately half of public employees" would live outside municipal boundaries in a decade if the state bans local residency requirements.

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2013 in a gubernatorial campaign television ad:
quote_txt: "Buono voted 154 times to raise our taxes -- like the sales tax, the income tax, health care taxes, even small business taxes."

description_txt: stated on May 12, 2013 in an interview on WPRI's Newsmakers program:
quote_txt: Historically, the Social Security tax has been assessed on about 90% of U.S. income. Now it captures 83% because there's been such a growth of income among the highest earners.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • May 19, 2013

description_txt: stated on May 8, 2013 in a flier:
quote_txt: Says paid family leave is "a program that is standard in all but five nations around the world."

description_txt: stated on April 27, 2013 in a speech.:
quote_txt: "Of our 98,000 teachers who are K-12, over 53,000 of those teachers today are over 50 years old."

description_txt: stated on May 14, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: A 0.05 standard for drunken driving means having a glass of wine at dinner could make a person drunk.

description_txt: stated on May 9, 2013 in a speech in Manor, Texas.:
quote_txt: Says that according to a report, "the tech sector now drives more than one-quarter of Austin’s economy."
